title.narrative: Emergency food security for returnee IDPs in Gogrial state (Formerly Warrap State).

description.narrative: This food security project seeks to provide critical humanitarian lifesaving food assistance in a way that contributes to community resilience and improvement of participant´s capacity to sustain their livelihoods and move away from dependency on food aid. The target group in this project is returning internally displaced people (IDPs), who initially fled the intercommunal violence resulting from the long-standing conflict between the Apuk and Ajugo communities in Gogrial state. This conflict has intensified along with the situation in the country. The efforts of DMI Sisters and other actors like the South Sudan Council of Churches (SSCC) together with the local government and the women federation system involved in peace efforts, has enabled them to feel secure enough to return. The project will be implemented by the local partner (Society of Daughters of Mary Immaculate, DMI Sisters). DMI is the only actor responding to the emergency due to the insecurity in the area.
